page.title: 05An Eckington farm part 2
page.content: After the wheat has been stored, it goes to the mill. At the mill it is stored until it is needed to make animal feed. Hay is made in June and July. From 40 acres of grass you can make 4500-5000 bales of hay. Most hay is used to feed dairy cattle, sheep and horses. Barley straw is sold as cattle feed and wheat straw is sold for cattle bedding. The main costs in growing arable crops are fertilizers and sprays. The main weeds you get in corn are wild oats, black grass, clover and may weed, and the main weeds in grass are thistles and dock. {Mr. Dyson's Market Garden:-}Mr. Dyson told me that he has six 2000sq.feet greenhouses, one 1200sq.ft greenhouse and a 6000sq.ft greenhouse that moves. He moves it three times a year. He grows vegetables which he sends to market. Some he sell locally.
